metadata.title: CVE-2020-24490 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Improper buffer restrictions in BlueZ may allow an unauthenticated user topotentially enable denial of service via adjacent access. This affects allLinux kernel versions that support BlueZ.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24490` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-48-generic - 5.4.0-48.52
linux-image-5.4.0-48-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-48.52
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-48-generic - 5.4.0-48.52
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-48-lowlatency - 5.4.0-48.52
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1048-oem - 5.6.0-1048.52
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1019-raspi - 5.4.0-1019.21
No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic-64k - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-lowlatency - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.10.0-1008-oem - 5.10.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1008-gkeop - 5.4.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-48.52').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1048.52').
linux-raspi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1019.21').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-raspi2-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.8 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1').
linux-oem-5.10 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.10.0-1008.9').
